abstract: JPMorgan Chase & Company and Morgan Stanley on Thursday became the latest banks to reach settlements with the New York attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, and other regulators as part of a investigation into the collapse of the auction-rate securities market.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase & Company and Morgan Stanley on Thursday became the latest banks to reach settlements with the New York attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, and other regulators as part of a investigation into the collapse of the auction-rate securit...
lead_paragraph: Two banks, JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley, on Thursday became the latest banks to reach settlements with the New York attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, and other regulators as part of a investigation into the collapse of the auction-rate securities market.

headline.main: JPMorgan, Morgan Stanley to Buy Back $7 Billion in Securities
